intro: Noronhia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf noronhia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Noronhia lanceolata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
